intro: Verbesina ecuatoriana, commonly known as the Ecuadorian beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy stems. The plant produces small, prickly fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
